title: Client–Server Architecture
explanation: The client is the interface users interact with (browser, mobile app). The server handles logic, authentication, data processing, and talks to the database. They communicate over HTTP.
confusion: Everything felt mashed together. It wasn’t clear where HTML stops and PHP or backend logic begins, or why the browser can’t just do everything.
click: Realizing the browser is basically a polite messenger. It asks for things and shows results, but the server is the one doing the heavy thinking and record keeping.

title: Authentication vs Authorization
explanation: Authentication answers “Who are you?” Authorization answers “What are you allowed to do?”
confusion: They sounded like the same thing, or the same process to achieve it.
click:
Authentication = Who are you?
Verifies identity. Login, password, OTP, biometrics. If this fails, you’re not in the system at all.
Authorization = What can you do?
Checks permissions after login. Controls access to pages, actions, and data.

title: Templates vs Dynamic Rendering
explanation: Templates define structure, dynamic rendering fills them with data at runtime.
confusion: It felt like content was “magically” appearing without being written into the page.
click: Understanding that templates are molds and data is the liquid poured in.
